match.desc_short: PHP based e-mail client
match.desc_full: AeroMail is a Web-based email client written in PHP. It uses an IMAP server to read and store messages in one or more user-defined folders, and its features include HTTP authentication for login (no cookies), folder manipulation, support for sending and viewing attachments, inline image display, multilanguage support, and URL highlighting.

match.desc_short: An Apache compilation toolbox.
match.desc_full: Apache Toolbox provides a means to easily compile Apache SSL, PHP(v3/v4), MySQL, Jakarta, a large number of modules (54 3rd party modules and 36 default Apache modules, static or as DSOs), and GD libraries with PNG+JPEG+Freetype2+zlib support. It is fully customizable and menu-driven. Everything is compiled from source, and wget is used to download any missing modules. It can also check for RPMs that might cause problems and create an RPM with your selections.

match.desc_short: Web-based user interface to IRC services.
match.desc_full: The Awesome Christians User Page is set of PHP scripts that allow you to access IRC services such as nickserv, memoserv, chanserv, and statserv through a Web interface. It is used by the Awesome Christians IRC network.

match.desc_short: PHP and IMAP based web mail application.
match.desc_full: BasiliX is a webmail application based on PHP and IMAP, and powered with the MySQL database server. It supports simple mail actions, sending/receiving attachments, an addressbook, settings utility, multiple languages, and multiple folders.

match.desc_short: A Web site content management system.
match.desc_full: basit is a Web site content management system developed using PHP. The package provides a Web- based user interface to configure all the attibutes of the Web site and add/edit/delete articles. A full usage manual including setup, administration, and maintenance is provided.

match.desc_short: A PHP Web counter on steroids.
match.desc_full: BBclone is a PHP Web counter on steroids, which displays individual logs as well as aggregated data. It is a clone of Big Brother webstats, except that it is written in PHP and it relies only on flat files (no database needed). BBclone enables any Web site administrator to have a very precise view of who visit the website: OS, browser, date, referring page etc. Main features include reload resistance, hostname resolution, proxy workaround, and blacklist.

match.desc_short: A Web forum server.
match.desc_full: BB-FORUMS is a Web forum server that creates a system permitting several forums administrated by different users. A forum can be public or moderated, and subscription-moderated. Moderated subscriptions or messages are easily accepted or rejected by the administrators of the forums into the web interface. It's written in PHP and MySQL, and can run with PHP safe mode.

match.desc_short: WWW based bookmark manager
match.desc_full: bookmarker is a WWW-based application for managing bookmarks. It allows multiple users to list, search, maintain, and create bookmarks. It is written in PHP using PHPLIB, which allows support for multiple databases. bookmarker includes functions to store URLs and send URLs via email directly from your browser (quik-mark, mail-this-link) using Javascript functions that link directly to the application. Netscape bookmark import is included as well as public/private settings to allow some/all bookmarks to be shared among users.

match.desc_short: Minimal news/weblog system
match.desc_full: bplog is a minimal news/weblog system using PHP, MySQL, and Apache.

match.desc_short: A high performance category caching system for PHP.
match.desc_full: CCat is a system for maintaing Categories in a MySQL database and caching path and child node displays. It prevents deep path calculation when displaying a path to category like "[Tolkien Books] - [Primary Works] - [The Hobbit] - [Special Editions] - [Millennium Editions]" and when displaying child nodes of the Category.

match.desc_short: A PHP class for database connection management.
match.desc_full: class.dbconn.php is a class for database connection management. It provides an easy way to store and reuse connections. This class is most useful when you don't know if you will need to connect to a database. Support for many connections is included.

match.desc_short: A PHP class to gzip encode served content before it is sent to the browser.
match.desc_full: class.gzip_encode.php is a class that will gzip content from a PHP script before it is sent to the Web browser if the browser supports gzip Content-Encoding. This can significantly decrease load time for pages over a slow connection. On some operating systems it can scale the compression level as the system load average increases.

match.desc_short: A PHP class for reading and writing MP3 ID3 tags.
match.desc_full: class.id3.php is a class for reading and writing MP3 ID3 tags and info about the MP3 stream. It was written and tested with PHP4.

match.desc_short: A currency converter that gets its info from the Web.
match.desc_full: cuco is a command-line PHP currency-converter which gets the info from oanda.com and outputs to the console by entering a value, the abbreviations of the currencies to convert, and optionally a date in the past to convert with the rate of that day. An option for listing the currency abbreviations is also included.

match.desc_short: A feature-added PHP redirect script.
match.desc_full: DeadMan's Redirect is a portal page creation system written in PHP. It acts as a jack-of-all-trades form which allows for URL redirection as well as an interface to various search engines through its aliasing system. It also supports user-set aliases with functional arguments and a history of all the URLs that pass through DMR. The user interface is created within DMR, using regular HTML which can be as simple or as advanced as you like.

match.desc_short: A PHP-based site search capable of filesystem and database searches.
match.desc_full: DGS Search is a PHP-based site search capable of filesystem and database searches on MySQL, PgSQL, MSSQL, InterBase, and ODBC sources. DGS Search does not require a database backend.

match.desc_short: Web-based reminder software
match.desc_full: E*Reminders is a series of PHP scripts that interact with a MySQL database to setup email reminders for any events or occasions you'd like. It includes recurring reminders, advance notices, and password authentication for email addresses. It can be used for an entire company, as a service for Internet users on your site, or privately.

match.desc_short: A MySQL/PHP billing DB.
match.desc_full: gcdb is an aesthetically pleasing MySQL/PHP billing database. It supports Customer, Payment, Invoice, Account, and Trouble Ticket entries. Meant for ISP, Hosting, or general billing.

match.desc_short: A PHP application framework.
match.desc_full: The Horde Application framework is a set of PHP classes providing common ways to handle preferences, browser detection, authentication, help systems, MIME, connection tracking, cross-application communication, and more.

match.desc_short: A PHP news portal engine.
match.desc_full: HPE provides a configurable way of building news boxes collected from many sources into your site. It is developed in PHP and uses MySQL to store information. News items are collected from many sources around the Web in formats ranging from XML/RSS to raw HTML. Users can select news sources, arrange them on a number of pages, and even browse themes.org themes.

match.desc_short: A PHP tool for administrating multiple .htpasswd files.
match.desc_full: HTAdmin is a PHP based tool for administrating multiple .htpasswd files.

match.desc_short: A shopping cart that uses XML/XSL.
match.desc_full: I-Store is a PHP/C++ e-business system that uses the XML/XSLT. It consists of PHP scripts for Web interface, an C++ program to manage the Internet shop, an C++ database management program, and an C++ program for processing the orders. Its main features include secure Internet payment, new product list, up to 30 shopping baskets for each registered customer, advertising for promoting products, searching for products by name, password protection for the registered customers, delivery and payment address, price in local currency and Euro, and more.

match.desc_short: IMAP and PHP3 based webmail system
match.desc_full: IMP allows universal, web-based access to IMAP and POP3 servers and provides an addressbook, LDAP directory searches, full support for sending and recieving attachments, and many other features normally only found in desktop mail clients. IMP is actively developed under the GPL.

match.desc_short: A PHP-based bug tracking package.
match.desc_full: Mantis is a PHP/MySQL-based bugtracking system. It is designed to be easy to deploy and customize. It supports multiple projects, email notification, and is localized for English, German, Italian, Spanish, French, and Portuguese.

match.desc_short: Collection of PHP-Classes to create PDFs
match.desc_full: PC4P (PDF Class for PHP) is a library of php-classes to speed up the creation of reports and letters with support for such things as tables, images, background-images, wordwrap, pagebreak, all kinds of text manipulations, and editing different pdf-pages simultaneously.

match.desc_short: PHP Mailing list archive viewer for Minorfish
match.desc_full: Phisherman is a web-based archive viewer for the mailing list Minorfish, written in PHP. The interface can easily be modified to match the colors of your website. Phisherman supports viewing the mailing list archives by year or by month.

match.desc_short: A PHP code library for building database-driven forms.
match.desc_full: Phormation is a set of PHP functions which provide a framework for developing any HTML form with a database backend (currently PostgreSQL and MySQL are supported). It allows you to write and make use of reusable widgets so you can develop Web sites more quickly. Phormation includes more than 10 widgets including text field, date, file upload, and select, and is easily extensible. It has good documentation. Both PHP3 and PHP4 are supported.

match.desc_short: An eCommerce application for PHP and mySQL.
match.desc_full: phorSale is a very basic Web and database e-commerce application. It features session-based order ("shopping cart") with session variables stored in cookies and URLs, user recognition via a unique identifer stored in a cookie and URL, "Lost Password" functionality, a placed order history viewer, dynamic shipping pricing generated by product weight from UPS and Federal Express (or by the use of a customer's own UPS/FedEx shipping number), and product searching by keywords, descriptions and titles. It has customizable HTML header/footer and product categories, a password-protected administrative interface, and product management to add, edit, delete, activate, and deactivate products via an admin interface. It provides credit card number/date validation, a CyberCash "wrapper" to parse responses from a local CGI, and the ability to edit stored profile information such as addresses, password, and email prefs.

match.desc_short: A web-based picture organizer.
match.desc_full: Photo Collection is a Web-based picture organizer. Pictures are indexed in a relational database (currently MySQL), and can be organized in hierachical categories. Each picture has a thumbnail and can have a name. It is written in PHP on the Web side, and there is a Perl client for database administration.

match.desc_short: PHP/MySQL photo album, designed for digital camera users.
match.desc_full: PPA/W ("P-paw") is a MySQL database that stores EXIF information (date taken, focal length, f-stop, etc) of digital photographs and presents it in a logical, attractive Web interface. Photos can be placed in up to five sections each, and each photo and section can have their own comments. Photos are added via a Perl script, and the user can manually add EXIF information to non-EXIF images. After photos are added, all administration functions (except deletion) are performed via the Web interface.

match.desc_short: Integrated Web applications.
match.desc_full: php(Reactor) is a set of Web applications which are designed to maximize user interaction. The core is a BBS/forum which supports flat, threaded, and ranked views. An articles board allows users to submit and comment on articles, and a content management system (cms) enables easy online maintenance of your pages. Other applications include e-cards, polls, and a complete admin suite. Users can create forums, create polls, and become moderators within the framework of the applications. php(Reactor) includes multilingual support and is template-based.

match.desc_short: A Web guestbook written in PHP3 with a MySQL backend.
match.desc_full: php3guest is a Web guestbook written in PHP using a MySQL backend. Entries can easily be edited or removed by the owner via a Web interface. Installation and configuration is easy and well documented. php3guest features modular language support with German, English, Chinese, Spanish, Hungarian, Italian, and Danish sample modules provided. The code is fully documented and is a fine starting point to learn PHP.

match.desc_short: A feature-rich PHP discussion board.
match.desc_full: phpBB is a UBB-style dissussion board written in PHP backended by a MySQL database. It includes features such as posting/replying/editing messages, private messages, private forums, user and anonymous posting, robust theming, user ranking by posts or by special, admin definable, ranks, and much more.

match.desc_short: A PHP based messaging system.
match.desc_full: phpBoard is ultimately aimed at becoming a messaging board system comparable to others such as Ultimate Bulletin Board (UBB) or ezBoard. It is a work in progress that is rapidly evolving to achieve this goal and is primed for a stable release very soon.

match.desc_short: A Bug Tracker written in PHP.
match.desc_full: phpBugTracker is an attempt to copy the functionality of Bugzilla while providing a codebase that is independent of the database and presentation layers.

match.desc_short: PHP class library to create and extend XML/XHTML-based documents.
match.desc_full: phpDOM is a PHP class library for creating and extending XML/XHTML-based documents. It can be easily extended to reflect several documents. It includes two packages: phpDOM for pure XML, and phpDOM.XHTML for well-formed XHTML documents. These two packages can be used as examples of how to extend the base classes. The library depends on the DOM/XML functions provided by PHP 4.0.x. However, these functions are not yet completed, and phpDOM therefore has some restrictions.

match.desc_short: A PHP/MySQL script to keep track of your DVD collection.
match.desc_full: phpDVD is a PHP script that allows you to keep track of your DVD collection. The information is stored in a MySQL database and an interface is provided to add, edit, and delete entries. Customizable fields allow you to display the details of importance to you; the default fields are: Title, Studio, Year, Original Aspect Ratio, and Audio Format. You can optionally link each title to its corresponding page at the Internet Movie Database.

match.desc_short: A Web-based software suite.
match.desc_full: phpGroupWare (formerly known as webdistro) is a multi-user groupware suite written in PHP. Its provides a Web-based calendar, todo-list, addressbook, email, news headlines, and a file manager. The calendar supports repeating events. The email system supports inline graphics and file attachments. The system as a whole supports user preferences, themes, user permissions, multi-language support, an advanced API, and user groups.

match.desc_short: Product management add-on module for phpGroupWare.
match.desc_full: phpGW inventory is an add-on application for phpGroupWare to provide product management.

match.desc_short: An add-on application for phpgroupware.
match.desc_full: phpgw projects is an add-on application for phpgroupware to provide project management. phpgw projects divide into hours accounting, invoicing and statistics.

match.desc_short: Simple PHP Web based POP e-mail reader
match.desc_full: phpop is a very simple Web-based POP e-mail reader. It lets you read, reply, forward, and delete messages from your POP server, as well as send new messages. It's written in PHP and utilizes the PHPLIB class library and the POP3 class.

match.desc_short: A PHP implementation of POP3.
match.desc_full: phPOP3 is a PHP layer for POP3. Through its API you can easily access POP3 email servers and read, delete, etc. email messages.

match.desc_short: Generates forms like OOH-Forms from PHPlib, but simpler.
match.desc_full: phpOpenFormGen uses simple definitions to create a form out of PHP code. It is similar to OOH-Forms, a tool that comes with PHPlib. You can store multiple form definitions in one file and simply use the function to display it on screen. It includes server-side error-handling, multiple language support, string-length checking, and more.

match.desc_short: A PHP tool to help track users through your site and measure its usability.
match.desc_full: phpOpenTracker is a site- and visitor-tracker that stores the collected data in an SQL database. An API for analysis, chart and report generation (via DocBook/XML and XSLT) with HTML and PDF output is included. phpOpenTracker provides clickpath analysis and usability measuring.

match.desc_short: A PHP-based Oracle 8 administration frontend.
match.desc_full: phpOracleAdmin is a Web-based Oracle Object Manager similar to Objectmanager and phpMyAdmin, but it offers more possibilities.

match.desc_short: An HTTP proxy written in PHP.
match.desc_full: PHPProxy is an HTTP proxy written in PHP. It allows you to convert your PHP hosting provider's Web servers into your personal proxy servers.

match.desc_short: An open source groupware suite.
match.desc_full: PHProjekt is a groupware suite which supports communication and management of teams and companies via an Intranet and the Internet. It consists of multiple components including a group calendar with resource booking, a time card system, project management, a request tracker, a mutual filesystem, a contact manager, a forum, chat, notes, todo lists, a voting system, reminders, and WAP- and PDA-access. Language files are available for 12 languages and the installation is a quick and easy installation procedure.

match.desc_short: Schedule creation and maintenance for shift based departments
match.desc_full: phpSched is an application for the creation and management of shift-based schedules. Current features include template creation, managing multiple departments, multiple shift types (regular shift, Supervisor shift, etc.), email notification, asking for or offering shifts, schedule publishing, and validation.

match.desc_short: PHP3 & PHP4 multi-language login and password client authentication.
match.desc_full: phpSecurePages is a PHP module to secure pages with a login name and password. It can handle multiple user groups (each with their own viewing rights), store data in a MySQL database or a configuration file, and be used to identify your Web site viewers. It also has multiple language support as well as session support for both PHP3 and PHP4.

match.desc_short: slash rewritten in PHP.
match.desc_full: phpSlash is a port of the slash-0.2 code from Perl to PHP. Since it was first started, phpslash has become a different beast of its own. It currently boasts full HTML templates, an OO design, the ability to operate in a hosted environment, and a bunch of other goodies.

match.desc_short: A PHP SMaSh client for sending SMSes via the Web.
match.desc_full: phpSmash is a PHP class implementing the SMASH Protocal as used by SMaSh, a GPL'ed SMS server supporting more than 19 operators.

match.desc_short: A framework for creating a Web-hosting site.
match.desc_full: PHPWebHosting is a framework for allowing users to store files and Web pages on a Web server with nothing more than a Web-based interface to the server. It is similar in function to the free Web-hosting that Geocities offers. Its features include unlimited directories, renaming of files, MIME-types, file sizes, sorting by different criteria, and more. It has advanced group support, with many public and private authentication options. A Web-based administration interface is included.

match.desc_short: Build dynamic webpages from HTML and PHP code snippets.
match.desc_full: PHPWidgets! is a tool for building dynamic webpages out of HTML and PHP code snippets. It provides a means of building pages using reusable elements. It can be set up to allow users to customise their accounts.

match.desc_short: Imlib2 extensions for PHP4.
match.desc_full: php_imlib is an extension for PHP4 that makes the Imlib2 image manipulation library available from within PHP scripts. The extension will build as a self-contained shared object, or as a module built into PHP.

match.desc_short: A PHP resource filemaneger with upload in the DB.
match.desc_full: PMF (PHP and MySql File manager) is a little PHP filemaneger that stores all its information in a MySQL database. It has its own upload capabilities, and it recognizes the MIME-type of the content. PMF can even be used as an image-database storage applet, giving you the ability to link directly to a resource in the database.

match.desc_short: A POP3-email WWW-interface.
match.desc_full: POP3-Checker is a POP3 email interface for the Web, written in PHP. It contacts the POP3 server via network sockets.

match.desc_short: A Web-based POP3 PHP mail-client.
match.desc_full: Popper is a Web based mail client that allows you to access your personal mailboxes on POP3 servers.

match.desc_short: A PostgreSQL session save handler for PHP4.
match.desc_full: PostgreSQL Session Handler for PHP is a custom session save handler for PHP4 that uses PostgreSQL as the session cache. This allows multiple Web servers to share a common session storage container and is useful for allowing Web users to move between machines while maintaining their session state.

match.desc_short: A small but reliable Webmail gateway.
match.desc_full: rymo (Read Your Mail Online) is written in PHP. It features a lightweight interface and needs a POP3 server for reading and an SMTP server for sending mail.

match.desc_short: A set of PHP classes to facilitate the creation and maintanence of a Portal.
match.desc_full: SiG is a set of PHP Classes to facilitate the creation and maintenance of an Information Portal.

match.desc_short: A document repository system.
match.desc_full: SDMS uses PHP to provide you with a pretty interface to a MySQL server that allows you to store and retrieve documents and to share those documents between users. In addition, the system uses ACLs (Access Control Lists) to grant access rights to documents on a per-user basis.

match.desc_short: A PHP3 Slashdot headline grabber.
match.desc_full: slashdot-php is a PHP-based Slashdot headline grabber. It uses the new XML backend (as the old one has been depreciated), and enables "light mode," which is useful for sending to a Palm Pilot.

match.desc_short: The PHP compiling template engine.
match.desc_full: Smarty is a template engine for PHP. Many other template engines for PHP provide basic variable substitution and dynamic block functionality. Smarty takes a step further to be a "smart" template engine, adding features such as configuration files, template functions, and variable modifiers, and making all of this functionality as easy as possible to use for both programmers and template designers. Smarty also converts the templates into PHP scripts, eliminating the need to parse the templates on every invocation. This makes Smarty extremely scalable and managable for large application needs.

match.desc_short: Snoopy is a PHP class that implements web client functionality.
match.desc_full: Snoopy is a PHP class that simulates a web browser. It can automate the task of retrieving web page content and posting forms, for example, and has many configurable parameters.

match.desc_short: A persistent database connection system.
match.desc_full: SQL Relay is a persistent database connection system supporting ODBC, Oracle, MySQL, mSQL, PostgreSQL, Sybase, MS SQL Server, DB2, Interbase, Lago and SQLite with C, C++, Perl, Python, Zope and PHP APIs, command line clients and a GUI configuration tool. It is ideal for speeding up database-driven web-based applications, accessing databases from unsupported platforms, migrating between databases, distributing access to replicated databases and throttling database access.

match.desc_short: A PHP4 Web-based email reader.
match.desc_full: SquirrelMail is a standards-based webmail package written in PHP4. It includes built-in pure PHP support for the IMAP and SMTP protocols, and all pages render in pure HTML 4.0 (with no Javascript) for maximum compatibility across browsers. It has very few requirements and is very easy to configure and install. SquirrelMail has a all the functionality you would want from an email client, including strong MIME support, address books, and folder manipulation.

match.desc_short: Streaming web-based chat.
match.desc_full: Stutter is a simple, Web-based chatroom application, written in PHP, that does not use Java or any type of plugin. It continuously streams the chat data, rather than refreshing the chat frame every so often.

match.desc_short: Customizable voting booth written in PHP using a MySQL backend.
match.desc_full: Sympoll is a highly-customizable PHP script used to create and display Web-based voting booths. Individual polls can easily be embedded into any Web page, and you can also link to a pre-formatted list of all available polls. Any number of polls may concurrently exist. Creation, modification, and deletion of polls is made extremely easy through a web-based adminstration page.

match.desc_short: A PHP/MySQL news backend.
match.desc_full: Thatware is a Slash lookalike. It is a Web-based news publishing and discussion backend written in PHP that can handle threaded discussions with a minimum of configuration and day-to-day management. It includes Web-based administration, polls, access statistics, user customizable boxes, a themes manager for registered users, the ability to edit or delete stories, a moderation system, search engine, backend/headlines generation (WAP and RSS/RDF format), and support for 7 languages.

match.desc_short: PHP application to keep track of hours worked on a project.
match.desc_full: Timesheet.php is a comprehensive multi-user online project tracking program. Users can keep track of hours worked on various projects and particular tasks. There is full support for client tracking and billing. Timesheet.php requires PHP3 or PHP4 and MySQL. It has only been tested under Apache.

match.desc_short: A web-based IMAP client written with PHP3
match.desc_full: TWIG is a web-based IMAP client written with PHP3. Its features include IMAP E-mail, contact management, scheduling, Usenet newsgroups, todo manager, and bookmark management. Any piece of information can be shared with other users on the system using TWIG's built-in groupware functionality. TWIG is written and implemented completely with the PHP programming language. The author's intention is that it becomes a simple, cross-platform, fast, and browser-independent way to access or share almost any kind of information, without the complexity or costs of other intranet/groupware packages.

match.desc_short: A Web-based Napster client written entirely in PHP.
match.desc_full: WebNap is a PHP Napster client that allows you to download songs from a Napster/Opennap/MyNapster or compatible server using a Web browser.

match.desc_short: PHP-powered Bulletin Board system
match.desc_full: Yet Another PHP Bulletin Board (YapBB) allows you to set up a forum on your Web site, using PHP4+MySQL. The goal of this project is to create a good, full featured, and free bulletin board. Features include multible boards, modular programming, different user authentication levels with appropriate privileges, a certain level of protection to prevent HTML abuse and abuse of other exploits, many client-side options, and more features to come.
